intro: Matisia sanblasensis, commonly known as the San Blas matisia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in humid, lowland forests and is adapted to tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
